questions.question_text: Which action protects against port scans from the internet?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be B, Zone Protection isn't available for Prisma Access.
It should be B since in SASE there are only two Zones and no interface mapping
strange question for SASE

Selected Answer: C
Definitely C.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.
Configure protection against floods, reconnaissance, packet-based attacks, and non-IP-protocol-based attacks with Zone Protection profiles.

Selected Answer: C
100% Zone Protection Profile

choices.B: Assign Security profiles to Security policy rules for traffic sourcing from the untrust zone.
choices.D: Assign an Interface Management profile to the zone of the ingress surface.
choices.A: Apply App-ID Security policy rules to block traffic sourcing from the untrust zone.
choices.C: Apply a Zone Protection profile on the zone of the ingress interface.

questions.question_text: Which CLI command allows visibility into SD-WAN events such as path selection and path quality measurements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/sd-wan/1-0/sd-wan-admin/troubleshooting/use-cli-commands-for-sd-wan-tasks
View SD-WAN events such as path selection and path quality measurements.

Selected Answer: D
show sd-wan event, so D

Selected Answer: D
It is PAN-OS SD-WAN, not Prisma SD-WAN hence D
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/sd-wan/3-1/sd-wan-admin/troubleshooting/use-cli-commands-for-sd-wan-tasks

D. >show sdwan event

The CLI command ">show sdwan event" allows visibility into SD-WAN events such as path selection and path quality measurements.

questions.question_text: Which statement applies to Prisma Access licensing?

choices.D: For remote network and Clean Pipe deployments, a unit is defined as 1 Mbps of bandwidth.
choices.B: It provides cloud-based, centralized log storage and aggregation.
choices.C: It is a perpetual license required to enable support for multiple virtual systems on PA-3200 Series firewalls.
choices.A: Internet of Things (IOT) Security is included with each license.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. is the correct answer.
B. It provides cloud-based, centralized log storage and aggregation. It is the wrong answer.
- Prisma Access integrates with Cortex Data Lake (now known as Strata Logging Service) for log storage, but this is licensed separately, not part of the Prisma Access license itself.

https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/resources/datasheets/prisma-access-licensing-guide

Selected Answer: D
I'ts D. RN or Clean Pipe use unit = mbps

Selected Answer: D
it's D

Selected Answer: D
mistaked

comments.content:
For remote network and Clean Pipe deployments, a unit is defined as 1 Mbps of bandwidth.
D

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-access/preferred/2-2/prisma-access-panorama-admin/clean-pipe/clean-pipe-overview

Selected Answer: D
Should be D

Selected Answer: D
See link below:
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma-access/administration/your-prisma-access-license

confirmed the answer is D

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-access/preferred/2-2/prisma-access-panorama-admin/prisma-access-overview/prisma-access-licensing
D. Prisma Access licensing is based on bandwidth consumption. For remote network and Clean Pipe deployments, one unit corresponds to 1 Mbps of bandwidth.

Selected Answer: B
I'm gonna go with "B" as Prisma Access stores logs in a cloud location (Cortex Data Lake) which is also a centralized locations that provides aggregation.

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD are the only ones that make sense.

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD, common sense given how the question is formulated
ABD is correct

questions.question_text: What are three ways the secure access service edge (SASE) model can help an organization? (Choose three.)

Which element of a secure access service edge (SASE)-enabled network provides true integration of services, not service chains, with combined services and visibility for all locations, mobile users, and the cloud?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/apps/pan/public/downloadResource?pagePath=/content/pan/en_US/resources/guides/sase-securing-internet-design-guide

 Converged WAN edge and network security—Provides true integration of services, not service 
chains, with combined services and visibility for all locations, mobile users, and the cloud.

Selected Answer: C
Converged WAN edge and network security—Provides true integration of services, not service
chains, with combined services and visibility for all locations, mobile users, and the cloud.

Selected Answer: C
MPIE's link is correct, C.

choices.C: converged WAN edge and network security
